title: Friday Flicks: Dangerously Delicious
content:
Back in October 2010 (which feels like an eternity ago), my friend Sashee invited me to see Aziz Ansari's Dangerously Delicious stand-up show. I'm a huge fan, so I was super excited to see him live. He was performing at The Fillmore in San Francisco, and we snagged awesome seats. I laughed—and even laughed so hard I cried—throughout the entire show; the way he talks when he's telling a story absolutely kills me. When I found out he released the Dangerously Delicious special on his website, I went straight home after work and watched it again. I almost choked on my dinner a few times, so I can attest it's just as funny the second time. I watched it streaming, but now I'm downloading it so I can play back my favorite parts whenever I need a good laugh during the week. It's available to stream and/or download from www.azizansari.com for just $5. I'd highly recommend it for some good weekend fun. Have you seen it?

{images via theguardian and Aziz is Bored}
